text:
Graziella Fumagalli (24 August 1944 in Casatenovo - 22 October 1995 in Merca) was an Italian doctor. She was a Catholic volunteer, killed in Somalia in 1995 at the Anti-tuberculosis Center which she directed.
Life.
She graduated in Medicine and Surgery in 1980. She specialized in Pediatric Surgery in France in 1985 and studied Tropical Medicine in 1989.
She moved to Guinea-Bissau with the non-governmental organization Mani Tese.
In 1993, she went to Mozambique as head of a health project of the Italian Association for Solidarity among Peoples (AISPO).
